drinkName.name: Remnants of Summer
drinkName.about: With this cocktail, you’ll never forget the season.

mix.how: In a mixing glass, muddle the cucumber, lime and maraschino liqueur.
Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice.
Rock the mixing glass back and forth 18 times and fine-strain into a chilled coupe glass.
Float a paper-thin cucumber slice on top.

drinkName.name: Agave Drop
drinkName.about: All the flavors of a Margarita are distilled down into this tasty shot.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a shot glass.
Garnish with a lime wedge.

drinkName.name: Spanish Raindrop
drinkName.about: If only the precipitation in the United States was this delicious

mix.how: Add the tequila, sherry, lime juice and simple syrup to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a shot glass.
Dip the orange zest in agave nectar and then in turbinado sugar.
Flame the zest over the glass to release its oils and rub along the rim.

drinkName.name: Cocoa Passion
drinkName.about: Tropical fruit, crème de cacao and fine tequila will please your palate.

mix.how: Fill a double shot glass three-quarters of the way with crushed ice.
Add all the ingredients in the order listed above.
If you're going to sip the drink, stir to combine.
Otherwise, shoot it and let it mix in your mouth.

drinkName.name: Mink Coat and No Manners
drinkName.about: A dressed-up tequila shot that’s ready to go out.

ingredients.ingredient: Green Chartreuse, chilled in the freezer

mix.how: Add the Green Chartreuse to a sherry copita glass.
Float the tequila on top and garnish with a pinch of cayenne pepper.

drinkName.name: 1870 Sour
drinkName.about: Unexpected flavor combinations abound in this whiskey, maple, blueberry and wine cocktail.

ingredients.ingredient: George Dickel Old No. 8 Tennessee Whisky
Ravenswood Sonoma County Old Vine Zinfandel

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the wine to a shaker.
Shake vigorously (without ice) for 10 seconds.
Fill with ice and shake for an additional 15 seconds.
Fine strain into a chilled 8-ounce Mason jar or a Bordeaux wine glass.
Float the wine on top using a spoon.

drinkName.name: White Lady
drinkName.about: She may look delicate, but this is one strong woman.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

drinkName.name: Kentucky Flyer
drinkName.about: Make an Aviation using all-American ingredients and you get this down-home cocktail.

mix.how: Add all of the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with five brandied cherries and a mint leaf speared on a pick.

drinkName.name: West Side
drinkName.about: Don’t start a turf war over this lemony vodka cocktail.

ingredients.ingredient: Simple syrup (one part sugar, one part water)

drinkName.name: Sparkler
drinkName.about: Make any day a celebration with this festive cocktail.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a Champagne flute.
Garnish with a strawberry slice.

drinkName.name: Forbidden Sour
drinkName.about: Break the rules by mixing pomegranate and bourbon together.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake vigorously and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with an orange wheel and a cherry.

drinkName.name: Arwell & Ado
drinkName.about: This vodka-and-grapefruit concoction is pure old-school.

mix.how: Coat the rim of a rocks glass with salt and fill with ice.
Add the remaining ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into the prepared glass.
Garnish with a lime wedge.

drinkName.name: Raspberry Collins
drinkName.about: Find out what happens when you add raspberries to this classic gin drink.

mix.how: In a highball glass, muddle the raspberries and simple syrup.
Add the gin and lemon juice, and stir.
Fill with ice and top with the club soda.
Garnish with a lemon wheel, a mint sprig and two raspberries.

drinkName.name: Camus Fresh
drinkName.about: A little lemon elevates the sophisticated flavor of cognac.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a cocktail shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a long strip of lemon peel.

drinkName.name: Bulleit Rye Smash
drinkName.about: Cool down with this simple and classic whiskey drink.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the mint, lemon, simple syrup and water.
Add the rye and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into an Old Fashioned glass filled with fresh crushed ice.
Garnish with a sprig of mint.

drinkName.name: Bayou Bloody Mary
drinkName.about: An extra-spicy Bloody Mary gets a crawfish-tail garnish for New Orleans flair.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients into a pint glass with ice and stir.
Garnish with 4 spiced pickled string beans, 2 olives and 4 crawfish tails.

drinkName.name: Vanilla Bourbon
drinkName.about: Exotic tamarind syrup is the secret to the drink.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the club soda to a cocktail shaker and fill with ice.
Shake and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with club soda and garnish with three brandied cherries on a toothpick.

drinkName.name: The Modern
drinkName.about: This rum drink is up-to-date.

ingredients.ingredient: Flor de Caña 7-Year-Old Grand Reserve Rum

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a Martini or coupe glass.
Garnish with 2 raspberries.

drinkName.name: Dirty Martini
drinkName.about: A dash of olive brine brings a salty, savory note to the all-time classic.

ingredients.ingredient:
Vodka
Try it with Absolut Elyx

mix.how: Add all the ingredients into a mixing glass with ice and stir.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with 2 olives.

drinkName.name: The Quetzal
drinkName.about: The distinct flavor of maple syrup turns this tropical drink into something more complex.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a cocktail shaker and fill with ice.
Shake well and strain into a Martini glass.
Garnish with a piece of pineapple leaf.

drinkName.name: Cowboy Coffee
drinkName.about: Crushed beans and Colorado whiskey make this tasty concoction fit for even the most grizzled cattle-driver.

mix.how: In a shaker, crush the coffee beans.
Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice.
Shake, and fine strain into a chilled Champagne flute.
Squeeze a lemon peel over the drink and garnish with the peel and an additional coffee bean.

drinkName.name: Tequila Daisy
drinkName.about: The Spanish word for daisy? Margarita.

mix.how: In a shaker, stir together the lemon juice and sugar.
Add the tequila and Grand Marnier, and fill with ice.
Shake well and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Top with a small splash of club soda.

drinkName.name: Greyhound
drinkName.about: Mixing up the Greyhound is as quick as its namesake.

ingredients.ingredient:
Vodka
Try it with Absolut Grapefruit

mix.how: Add the vodka into a Collins glass with ice.
Top with the juice and stir.
Garnish with a lemon or lime wedge.
(To make a Salty Dog, coat the rim of the glass with salt and leave out the garnish.).

drinkName.name: The Seersucker
drinkName.about: Wear this on a hot day.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the strawberry.
Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a pilsner glass filled with crushed ice.
Garnish with an additional strawberry.

drinkName.name: Sparkling Açaí Sangria
drinkName.about: Whip up a pitcher of this bubbly, fruity concoction at your next party.

ingredients.ingredient: 12.5 oz (half a bottle) VeeV Açaí S­­pirit

mix.how: Fill a pitcher three-quarters of the way with ice.
Add all the ingredients except the sparkling wine and stir well.
Top with sparkling wine and garnish with blueberries, sliced strawberries and orange wedges.

drinkName.name: Cucumber Fizz
drinkName.about: Subtle sweetness and refreshing coolness make this a perfect warm-weather cocktail.

ingredients.ingredient: Grey Goose La Poire flavored vodka

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the cucumber.
Add the vodka, St-Germain, lemon juice and simple syrup, and fill with ice.
Shake vigorously and strain into a highball glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with mint, cucumber slices and lemon zest and top with lemonade or club soda.

drinkName.name: Another Fine Mes
drinkName.about: This drink proves that rye and tequila belong together.

mix.how: Add the maple syrup, rye and tequila to a mixing glass and stir until combined.
Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with an orange twist.

drinkName.name: Tequila Mockingbird
drinkName.about: Tequila and watermelon is a woefully underused combination.

ingredients.ingredient:
Silver tequila
Try it with Altos Plata

mix.how: Muddle the jalapeño and watermelon in a shaker.
Add the remaining ingredients and ice, and shake until well-chilled.
Fine-strain into a rocks glass over fresh ice.

drinkName.name: After-Dinner Sazerac
drinkName.about: A coffee-liqueur rinse turns the classic whiskey cocktail into a digestive delight.

mix.how: Rinse a chilled Old Fashioned glass with Galliano Ristretto and set aside.
In a mixing glass, muddle the bitters and sugar cube.
Add the whisky and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into the prepared glass.
Break a kaffir lime leaf in four places over the drink, run along the rim of the glass and discard.

drinkName.name: The LiberTea
drinkName.about: Feel free to share this bourbon-lemonade punch with your friends.

mix.how: In a large saucepan, bring 2 cups of the water to a boil.
Remove from heat and add the tea bags.
Steep for 8 minutes and then discard the bags.
Add the lemonade and the remaining 2 cups of water.
Transfer the mixture to a pitcher and chill.
Stir in the basil and crush with a spoon until fragrant.
Stir in the bourbon and liqueur.
Pour into tall glasses filled with ice and garnish each glass with a lemon wheel.

drinkName.name: Grand Orange Collins
drinkName.about: This fizzy, citrusy concoction is distantly related to its cousin Tom.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the club soda to a shaker.
Fill with ice and shake hard.
Strain into a Collins glass filled with fresh ice and top with the club soda.
Stir with a spoon and garnish with an orange wheel.

drinkName.name: Açaí-Blueberry Mojito
drinkName.about: Overdose on antioxidants.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the mint, blueberries and simple syrup.
Add the vodka and lime juice, and fill with ice.
Shake well and strain into a highball or rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with club soda and garnish with a mint sprig or skewer of additional blueberries.

drinkName.name: Strawberry Cucumber Caipirinha
drinkName.about: Sweet, cooling, and perfect for warm weather.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the lemon, cucumber, strawberries and sugar.
Fill with ice and add the cachaça.
Shake, and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with strawberry and cucumber slices.

drinkName.name: Country Thyme
drinkName.about: You can drink this blueberry cocktail in the city, too.

mix.how: Place the thyme sprig in the palm of your hand and slap it to release its oils.
Twist it and place in the bottom of a 10-ounce highball or Old Fashioned glass.
Fill with ice and set aside.
In a shaker, muddle the blueberries and lemon. (If blueberries are out of season, use 2 teaspoons of high-quality blueberry preserves instead.
You'll have to adjust the amount of agave nectar depending on the sweetness of the preserves.) Add the vodka and agave nectar, and fill with ice.
Shake vigorously for 10 to 20 seconds and strain into the prepared glass.
Take a nice large, pretty sprig of thyme and slap it before using to garnish the drink.

drinkName.name: Baldwin Apple
drinkName.about: This autumnal apple-brandy cocktail gets added depth from three different rich syrups.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker.
Shake briefly without ice to combine.
Fill with ice, hard shake and strain into a chilled coupe glass.
Garnish with grated nutmeg.

drinkName.name: Charrita Margarita
drinkName.about: Try talented mixologist Junior Merino’s take on the classic tequila cocktail.

mix.how: Coat the rim of a Margarita or cocktail glass with salt.
Add the remaining ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and pour (unstrained) into the prepared glass.
Garnish with a lime wheel.

drinkName.name: Midnight Smash
drinkName.about: This blackberry-ginger cocktail is even good in the afternoon.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the blackberries.
Add the lemon juice, Averna and vodka, and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a highball glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with the ginger beer and garnish with a few blackberries.

drinkName.name: The Perfect Storm
drinkName.about: Get your sea legs with this nautical spiced-rum concoction.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients, except ginger beer, to a highball or rocks glass filled with ice.
Garnish with a lime wedge.
Top with ginger beer.

drinkName.name: Bâton Rouge
drinkName.about: Like the Vieux Carré? Try this rum and pear-cognac liqueur version of the classic.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a long lemon twist.

drinkName.name: Sir Hayden’s Smash
drinkName.about: Cool down with this icy blackberry and bourbon refresher.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the blackberries, mint and simple syrup.
Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice.
Shake, and fine strain into a wine glass filled with crushed ice.
Garnish with an additional blackberry.

drinkName.name: Reserve Luxury Daiquiri
drinkName.about: This twist on the summery classic is rich with antioxidants.

ingredients.ingredient: Demerara syrup (one part Demerara sugar, one part water)

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the blackberry.
Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a chilled Martini glass.
Garnish with a lime wheel.

drinkName.name: Bitter Lemon Cooler
drinkName.about: Get a taste of summer with this citrusy gin drink.

ingredients.ingredient: Bitter lemon soda or lemon-flavored club soda

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the soda to a cocktail shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a Collins glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with bitter lemon soda or lemon-flavored club soda and garnish with a lemon wheel.

drinkName.name: The Ruby Patch
drinkName.about: An all-organic strawberry-and-mint cocktail.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the strawberries and mint.
Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice.
Shake for 10 seconds and double strain into a Collins glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a strawberry.

drinkName.name: Coral Reef
drinkName.about: This bitter-and-sweet gin cocktail is named for its lovely orange color.

mix.how: Add the gin, St-Germain and Aperol to a highball glass and fill with ice.
Top with club soda and garnish with a lemon twist.

drinkName.name: Patrón Pomegranate
drinkName.about: Find out what happens when premium tequila meets antioxidant-rich fruit juice.

mix.how: Add the tequila and orange liqueur to a rocks glass filled with ice.
Fill with pomegranate juice and finish with a squeeze of lime.

drinkName.name: Cinquecento
drinkName.about: With Polish vodka and French and Italian liqueurs, this aperitif is a grand European tour in a glass.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and double strain into a chilled coupe glass.
Garnish with a grapefruit twist.

drinkName.name: NZ Sauvignon Blanc Punch
drinkName.about: Surprisingly, the vibrant white wine pairs nicely with bitter Aperol.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the soda to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a highball glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with soda.

drinkName.name: Moët Golden Glamour
drinkName.about: This official cocktail of the 2010 Academy Awards is appropriately elegant.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a coupe glass.
Garnish with a fresh mint sprig.

drinkName.name: The Complete Irish Meal
drinkName.about: A whiskey supper from the Emerald Isle.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake vigorously and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

drinkName.name: Cognac Mint Julep
drinkName.about: Make this classic the old-fashioned way, with French brandy.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the mint, sugar and a dash of water.
Add the cognac and fill with shaved ice.
Shake until frosted and pour (unstrained) into a rocks glass.
Garnish with a mint sprig.

drinkName.name: Grand Margarita
drinkName.about: Jazz up your ‘rita with a bit of Grand Marnier.

mix.how: If desired, moisten the rim of a rocks or cocktail glass and coat with salt.
If using a rocks glass, fill with ice.
Add the remaining ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into the prepared glass.
Garnish with a lime wheel.

drinkName.name: The Barents Sea Collins
drinkName.about: Go on a tour of northern Europe.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the club soda to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a highball or Collins glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with club soda and garnish with a lemon wedge.

drinkName.name: Lime Bumboo
drinkName.about: A lime brown sugar syrup gives this tropical refresher complex flavor.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a highball glass filled with ice.
Garnish with grated nutmeg and a lime wedge.

drinkName.name: Pineapple Vanilla Mojito
drinkName.about: It’s not traditional, but it is tropical and tasty.

mix.how: Muddle the pineapple, mint and agave nectar in a tumbler, being careful not to pulverize the mint.
Add the rum, Navan and a handful of ice.
Top with club soda and stir.
Garnish with a pineapple wedge and a mint leaf.

drinkName.name: Scramble
drinkName.about: Beat the rush for this drink.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the crème de mure to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into an Old Fashioned glass filled with crushed ice.
Drizzle the crème de mure over the top of the drink and garnish with a lemon spiral twist and 3 blackberries.

drinkName.name: Riviera
drinkName.about: This deep-red drink is perfect for a romantic evening.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake well and strain into a chilled Martini glass.
Garnish with a blood orange slice.

drinkName.name: Grey Goose Le Citron Asian Mary
drinkName.about: Spice up this classic with a wasabi-spiked tomato mix.

ingredients.ingredient: Grey Goose Le Citron Flavored Vodka

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a cocktail shaker and fill with ice.
Shake vigorously and strain into a large tumbler filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with shiso or cilantro leaves and a lemon wheel.

drinkName.name: Superfruit Margarita
drinkName.about: Go heavy on the antioxidants.

mix.how: Fill a pitcher three-quarters of the way with ice.
Add all the ingredients and stir well.
Garnish with lime wheels.

drinkName.name: Kiwi Kwencher
drinkName.about: Mix up this refreshing fresh-and-fruity cocktail.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the kiwi.
Add the simple syrup and St-Germain, and fill with ice.
Shake until chilled and add a splash of club soda.
Strain into a cocktail glass and top with the sparkling wine.
Garnish with a kiwi slice.

drinkName.name: Ile Rouge
drinkName.about: A French name and an exotic flavor.

mix.how: Muddle the peppercorns in a shaker.
Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice.
Shake and strain into a chilled Martini glass.
Garnish with a few more peppercorns.

drinkName.name: Pomchi Smash
drinkName.about: A fruity taste of summer.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the raspberries and mint leaves.
Add the remaining ingredients except the ginger ale and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a highball or large wine glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with ginger ale and garnish with a raspberry and a mint sprig.

drinkName.name: 56 Julep
drinkName.about: Named for Jimmy Russell’s 56 years distilling Wild Turkey.

mix.how: In a traditional silver julep cup or double Old Fashioned glass, muddle the mint, brown sugar and 1 ounce of the bourbon.
Add the ice and remaining bourbon, and garnish with a sprig of mint.

drinkName.name: Horse’s Neck
drinkName.about: The American-whiskey classic has only two ingredients.

ingredients.ingredient: Bourbon, brandy or American rye whiskey

mix.how: Add the whiskey to a Collins glass filled with ice.
Fill with ginger ale and garnish with a long strip of lemon peel.

drinkName.name: Preakness
drinkName.about: A splash of herbal Bénédictine gives this Manhattan variation added complexity.

mix.how: Add all in the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a lemon twist.

drinkName.name: Royal Balmoral Punch
drinkName.about: Named for the Royal Family’s Scottish summer home, this drink combines fine single malt and good English tea.

mix.how: Add the Scotch, syrup and apple juice to a teacup and add a large ice cube.
Top with equal amounts of lemonade and Champagne.
Garnish with a lemon wheel and thistle.
(This recipe can multiplied to serve a crowd: Mix in a punch bowl with a large block of ice.).

drinkName.name: Hot in Rio
drinkName.about: This chile pepper, lime and cachaça cocktail captures the spirit of Brazilian Carnaval.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the agave nectar, chile pepper slices and lime wedges.
Add the remaining ingredients and fill with crushed ice.
Shake, and pour (unstrained) into a rocks glass.
Garnish with additional chile pepper slices or a lime wedge.

drinkName.name: Man o’ War
drinkName.about: Named for one of the finest racehorses in history, this citrusy bourbon drink inspires.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with an orange or lemon twist and a brandied cherry on a cocktail pick.

drinkName.name: Princess Mary’s Pride
drinkName.about: This calvados cocktail was created in honor of Princess Mary’s 1922 wedding.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a cocktail glass.
Garnish with an orange peel.

drinkName.name: Double Eagle
drinkName.about: A set of international flavors livens up this bourbon cocktail.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the lemon and basil.
Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice.
Shake, and double strain into a Martini glass.
Garnish with a grapefruit peel and Thai basil leaf.

drinkName.name: Grand Sidecar
drinkName.about: Simple, sweet and sour.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker (adjusting simple syrup to tartness of lemons) and fill with ice.
Shake hard, and strain into a chilled Martini glass half-rimmed with sugar.

drinkName.name: Diamond Blue
drinkName.about: Inspired by Kate Middleton’s giant sapphire engagement ring, this luxurious cocktail is royally delicious.

mix.how: Add the gin, crème de violette and Curaçao to a mixing glass.
Squeeze the lemon wedge into the glass and discard.
Fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a Champagne flute.
Top with the Champagne and garnish with a light dusting of edible silver powder.

drinkName.name: Louisville Cocktail
drinkName.about: You don’t have to be in Kentucky to enjoy this three-ingredient bourbon cocktail.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a large orange twist.

drinkName.name: Breakfast Margarita
drinkName.about: Start your day with this delicious orange-marmalade Margarita.

ingredients.ingredient: Agave syrup (one part Partida agave nectar, one part water)

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with an orange slice.

drinkName.name: Celery Cup No. 1
drinkName.about: With celery, cilantro and cucumber, it’s like a liquid salad.

ingredients.ingredient: Celery (use a piece closer to the heart for sweetness)

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the cucumber, celery, cilantro and lemon juice to a pulp.
Add the vodka, agave nectar and Pimm's, and fill with ice.
Shake hard for 10 seconds and strain into a tall glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a leafy celery stalk from the heart.

drinkName.name: Patrón Grapefruit
drinkName.about: Grapefruit is a great match for tequila and orange liqueur.

mix.how: Add the tequila and liqueur to a highball glass full of ice.
Top with grapefruit juice.
Add a splash of club soda and garnish with lemon and lime slices.

drinkName.name: Basil Hayden’s Kentucky Buck
drinkName.about: As majestic and strong as its namesake.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake well.
Strain into a Collins glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a lemon wheel.

drinkName.name: Navan Smash
drinkName.about: Brighten your evening with this vanilla, mint and lemon cocktail.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the lemon wedges and mint leaves.
Add the Navan and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a mint sprig stuck into a lemon wheel.

drinkName.name: Skinny Mojito
drinkName.about: Its flavor is full-size.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the mint and lime.
Add the rum and agave nectar, and fill with ice.
Shake, and pour (unstrained) into a highball glass.
Top with club soda and garnish with a lime wheel.

drinkName.name: Grand Sangria
drinkName.about: An orange twist on the classic fruity wine concoction.

ingredients.ingredient: Apples, red and green, cored and cut into .5 inch wedges

mix.how: Combine all the ingredients except the orange juice and wine in a punch bowl and let stand at least 1 hour.
Stir the orange juice and wine, and serve in ice-filled punch cups or wine glasses.

drinkName.name: Vita Coco Caipirinha
drinkName.about: The South American cocktail endorsed by Demi Moore and Madonna.

mix.how: Fill an Old Fashioned glass with ice.
Squeeze the lime wedges into the glass and then add the wedges and sugar.
Fill the glass a third of the way with cachaca.
Fill with Vita Coco Tangerine and stir gently.

drinkName.name: Hot Caramel Buttered Rum
drinkName.about: The ultimate indulgence: a sweet caramel-and-spice cocktail with a pat of rich butter.

ingredients.ingredient: Hot water, add more if desired

mix.how: In a mug, stir together the butter, brown sugar, honey and spices until they've formed a batter.
Add the remaining ingredients and stir vigorously until the batter is fully dissolved.
Garnish with a cinnamon stick.

drinkName.name: The Collins
drinkName.about: The classic original, from the original celebrity bartender, Jerry Thomas.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the soda to a shaker and fill with large, hard, cold ice cubes.
Shake, and double-strain into a Collins glass fill with fresh ice.
Top with soda and garnish with a lemon wedge.

drinkName.name: Black Velvet
drinkName.about: High-class meets working-class.

mix.how: Fill a highball glass halfway with beer.
Pouring over a spoon into the glass, fill to the top with Champagne.

drinkName.name: Pisco Sour
drinkName.about: Both Chile and Peru claim the classic Pisco Sour as their own.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake vigorously and strain into a highball glass or Champagne flute.
Garnish with a lime wheel and 3 gentle drops of Angostura Bitters, which will settle in the foam of the cocktail.
Using a straw, swirl the bitters into a simple design.

drinkName.name: Strawberry Daiquiri
drinkName.about: The Strawberry Daiquiri is a classic summertime drink. Chill down with this frosty rum concoction.

ingredients.ingredient: Aged Puerto Rican or Jamaican rum

mix.how: To make the Strawberry Daiquiri add all the ingredients to a blender.
Blend until smooth and pour into a Margarita glass or wine goblet.
Garnish with an orchid and a cocktail umbrella.

drinkName.name: Savory Margarita
drinkName.about: A sip of this concoction will convince you that red bell pepper deserves a place behind the bar.

ingredients.ingredient: Honey syrup (one part honey, one part water)

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a lime wheel.

drinkName.name: Wilson’s Smash
drinkName.about: Caramelized-pineapple syrup makes this tropical rum drink something very special.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the club soda to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and fine-strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with a splash of club soda and garnish with a lemon wheel.

drinkName.name: Sparkling Holiday Punch
drinkName.about: Every day is a holiday with this fizzy, fruity vodka punch.

mix.how: In a large bowl, muddle the orange peels and sugar to form a paste.
Add the lemon juice, syrup and both vodkas, and stir to combine.
Place a large block of ice in a punch bowl and add the vodka mixture.
Top with the sparkling wine and water.
Stir, and garnish with thinly cut lemon wheels and thin slices of fig.

drinkName.name: Very Sexy Martini
drinkName.about: Celebrate in style.

ingredients.ingredient: Simple syrup (one part sugar, one part water)

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the raspberries and mint.
Add the remaining ingredients except the Champagne and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a Martini glass.
Top with the Champagne and garnish with a mint spring and a raspberry.

drinkName.name: Witch’s Brew
drinkName.about: Indulge with this chocolate-raspberry vodka and Champagne treat.

mix.how: Add the vodka and crème de cassis to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake well and strain into a Champagne flute.
Top with chilled Champagne.

drinkName.name: Corzo Tequila Toast
drinkName.about: Put on your top hat and tails to drink this sparkling concoction.

mix.how: Add the tequila and cognac to a chilled Champagne flute and fill with Champagne.
Garnish with raspberries.

drinkName.name: Cinnamon Sparkle
drinkName.about: Crémant d’Alsace sparkling wine completes this tasty rum-and-cognac cocktail.

ingredients.ingredient: Flor de Caña 7-Year-Old Grand Reserve Rum

mix.how: In a mixing glass, muddle the sugar cubes in the club soda until dissolved.
Stir in the remaining ingredients, except for the wine, one at a time.
Fill with ice and continue stirring until chilled.
Strain into a coupe or punch glass and top with the wine.
Garnish with a cinnamon stick.

drinkName.name: Ginepro Amaro
drinkName.about: An old-school recipe for a gin-and-juice.

mix.how: In a mixing glass stir the ingredients with large, hard, cold ice cubes and double strain into a rocks glass.
Garnish with an orange twist.

drinkName.name: E-Sencha-L
drinkName.about: Don’t pass up this gin-and-tea cocktail.

mix.how: Add both ingredients to a Martini glass or small tea cup and stir to combine.
Garnish with a grapefruit twist.

drinkName.name: Baileys Peppermint Cream
drinkName.about: Hot chocolate + minty liqueur + whipped cream = an adult dessert.

ingredients.ingredient: Baileys with a Hint of Mint Chocolate

mix.how: Pour the Baileys and hot chocolate into a coffee mug.
Top with a dollop of whipped cream and sprinkle crushed candy cane on top.
Garnish with a mint leaf.

drinkName.name: Passion Potion
drinkName.about: Cupid would approve of this rum, fruit and basil recipe.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake vigorously for 5 seconds and strain into a chilled coupe glass.
Garnish with a basil leaf.

drinkName.name: The Manhattan 101
drinkName.about: A mint and ginger version of the standard formula.

mix.how: Muddle the ginger, mint, powdered sugar and bitters in a cocktail shaker.
Add the Wild Turkey Bourbon, both vermouths and ice.
Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a cherry.

drinkName.name: Grey Goose Mediterranean Mary
drinkName.about: Olive tapenade and herbs take this savory Bloody Mary to another level.

ingredients.ingredient: Grey Goose Vodka (Original or Le Citron)

mix.how: Rub the lemon wedge on the outer edge of a tall glass and then roll the glass lip in the salt.
Add the remaining ingredients to a cocktail shaker and fill with ice.
Shake vigorously and strain into the prepared glass.
Garnish with a cucumber spear and an olive.

drinkName.name: Tom Collins
drinkName.about: Master the all-time gin classic. The Tom Collins is essentially a sparkling lemonade spiked with a healthy dose of the juniper spirit. While there is a debate which side of the pond this drink was born, this cocktail lives up to his classic status with every sip.

ingredients.ingredient: Simple syrup (1 part water, 1 part sugar)

mix.how: Add the lemon juice, simple syrup and gin into a shaker with ice and shake well.
Strain into a highball or Collins glass over fresh ice.
Top with club soda.
Garnish with a lemon wheel and cherry, and serve with a straw.
